summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 between Bureau of Prisons officials discussing inmate Jeffrey Epstein's status at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It details his removal from suicide watch to psychological observation, a pending incident report for self-mutilation, and plans to house him with another inmate, Cesar Sayoc, in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

events.title: Epstein removed from Suicide Watch
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein was removed from Suicide Watch and stepped down to Psychological Observation status. He was escorted for a medical assessment and then to meet with his attorney.

events.title: Pending Incident Report for Self-Mutilation
events.description: Epstein was pending a Code 228 incident report for 'Tattooing or Self-Mutilation' after officers observed him with a makeshift noose around his neck. He was scheduled for a UDC hearing.

events.title: Sayoc's scheduled release
events.description: Inmate (MI), who was considered as a potential cell mate for Epstein, was scheduled for release on this date.

events.title: Cesar Sayoc pleads guilty
events.description: Cesar Sayoc pleaded guilty to mailing improvised explosive devices to prominent figures including Barack Obama, Joe Biden, Hillary Clinton, Cory Booker, and Kamala Harris.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was on 'Psychological Observation' status at MCC New York in July 2019, having been stepped down from Suicide Watch.
Epstein faced a pending disciplinary report (Code 228) for self-mutilation after officers observed him with a makeshift noose around his neck.
Plans were made to house Epstein in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with inmate Cesar Sayoc, who was in protective custody after pleading guilty to mailing explosives.
The email chain shows Bureau of Prisons officials closely monitoring Epstein's status and housing arrangements just weeks before his death.
The definition of 'Psychological Observation' indicates Epstein was deemed to have an impaired mental status but was not considered imminently suicidal.
